page.title: 02Wistow Hall near Kilby
page.content: Wistow Hall once belonged to the Halford family but has now been converted into flats for rent. Other parts have been developed into a garden and aquatic centre. At the time of the Battle of Naseby 14th July 1645 King Charles I and Prince Rupert called here while retreating from Naseby to Leicester. While there they exchanged saddles which are still beautifully preserved. The Hall stands in an 18th Centuary park with a small lake. Other parts of the holding have been turned into Wistow Park now partly a public open space. Although parking is limited and animals still graze on the site it is well used as a place of public recreation.
